#id=1
#text=Some years ago , I used my bike to get around town a lot .
#id=2
#text=Of course , came the time when you have to make repairs .
#id=3
#text=I found out a lot about bicycle tires during this time .
#id=4
#text=My tire had a leak so I bought a repair kit .
#id=5
#text=I had no idea how to use it but I did find out .
#id=6
#text=I had to take the whole wheel off the bicycle .
#id=7
#text=Next I pried the tires from the rim and that took some doing .
#id=8
#text=Okay once I got that off I had to take the inner tube out also and I learned that I had to be very careful with the inner tube because I could cause more damage by being rough .
#id=9
#text=Next , I took the inner tube to the gas station to get air since I did n't have a manual air pump .
#text=I learned really quickly that I needed to fill the inner tube with care or I would be buying another one since the air fills it quickly and the tube can pop .
#text=Once I put a little air in the tube I had to listen as I pressed the air out to determine where the leak was actually at .
#text=Once the leak location was identified then I was able to take the tube home and use the glue from the kit and apply the rubber patch .
#text=Of course I had to allow the tube to dry and then deflate it to get it back on the bicycle .
#text=Once I got it all put back together I walked my bike back to the gas station for air .
